required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Double Blind Placebo Controlled Study to Evaluate the Effects of Bexagliflozin on Hemoglobin A1c in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes and Increased Risk of Cardiovascular Adverse Events

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of bexagliflozin in lowering hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) levels in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) and increased risk of cardiovascular adverse events.
The data from this study will be combined with the data from other bexagliflozin studies in a meta-analysis of CV safety outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock:
Approximately 130 investigative sites globally are planned to participate in this study.
An estimated 1650 subjects with inadequately controlled T2DM and an elevated risk of cardiovascular adverse events will be randomized to bexagliflozin tablets, 20 mg, or placebo in a ratio of 2:1 in addition to the background anti-diabetic medications.
The study is an event-driven trial. The treatment period will end when the last randomized subject has completed at least 52 weeks of treatment and a total of at least 134 subjects have experienced a cardiac event.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 24
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy objective of this trial is to evaluate the placebo-adjusted change in HbA1c from baseline after 24 weeks of treatment with 20 mg bexagliflozin tablets in type 2 diabetic subjects with increased risk of cardiovascular adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 24 for Subjects Who Have Been Prescribed Insulin
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of 20 mg bexagliflozin on the change in HbA1c from baseline to week 24 in randomized subjects who have been prescribed insulin to control their diabetes

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of 20 mg bexagliflozin on the change in body weight from baseline to week 48 in randomized subjects with a BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2 compared to placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 24 in Subjects Hypertensive at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of 20 mg bexagliflozin on the change in systolic blood pressure (SBP) from baseline to week 24 in subjects with baseline systolic blood pressure ≥ 140 mmHg compared to placebo

other_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline Over Time
other_outcome.description: To assess the effect of 20 mg bexagliflozin treatment on the change in HbA1c from baseline versus placebo over time up to 168 weeks

other_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose Over Time
other_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of bexagliflozin treatment on the change in fasting plasma glucose (FPG) versus placebo over time up to 168 weeks

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Requiring an Intensification of Hypoglycemic Agent and Time to First Intensification
other_outcome.description: To measure the proportion of subjects requiring an intensification of hypoglycemic agent in the bexagliflozin arm versus placebo during 24 week period

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Requiring an Intensification of Hypoglycemic Agent and Time to First Intensification
other_outcome.description: To measure the proportion of subjects requiring an intensification of hypoglycemic agent in the bexagliflozin arm versus placebo during the entire study period

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Requiring a Relaxation of Hypoglycemic Agent
other_outcome.description: To measure the proportion of subjects requiring a relaxation of hypoglycemic agent in the bexagliflozin arm versus placebo during 24 week period

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Requiring a Relaxation of Hypoglycemic Agent
other_outcome.description: To measure the proportion of subjects requiring a relaxation of hypoglycemic agent in the bexagliflozin arm versus placebo during the entire study

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Incidence of Hospitalization for Heart Failure
other_outcome.description: To measure the incidence of hospitalization for heart failure among all subjects and among subjects who have a history of heart failure at baseline

arm_group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study.
Each subject will receive placebo (inactive tablet) once daily for the duration of the study.

intervention.description: 20 mg tablet to match active comparator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a diagnosis of T2DM
- Subjects who have had a stable treatment regimen for T2DM for the past 3 months
- Subjects who present with at least one of the following 3 histories:
Group 1: A history of atherosclerotic vascular disease Group 2: A history of heart failure Group 3: Age ≥ 55 years with diabetes for ≥ 10 years, uncontrolled hypertension, currently smoking, reduced kidney function, or cholesterol problems
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of type 1 diabetes mellitus or maturity-onset/diabetes of the young
- History of genitourinary tract infections
- Evidence of abnormal liver function
- History of MI, stroke or hospitalization for heart failure in the past 3 months
- Prior kidney transplant or evidence of kidney problems
- Prior or planned pace maker implantation
- Pregnant or nursing

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 1700 patients were recruited from 10 countries: Canada, Czech Republic, Demark, Republic of Korea, Mexico, the Netherlands, Poland, Russian Federation, Taiwan, and the United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects ≥ 40 years old with inadequately controlled T2DM with HbA1c between 7.5% (7.0% since protocol version 8) and 11% on stable medications and elevated risk for CV adverse events were enrolled. All subjects must belong to 1 of 3 CV risk groups to be eligible. All eligible subjects took placebo during 13 ± 2 days run-in period.

group.title: Bexagliflozin Tablets, 20 mg
group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study. Bexagliflozin: 20 mg, tablet

group.title: Placebo Tablets
group.description: Each subject will receive placebo (inactive tablet) once daily for the duration of the study. Placebo: 20 mg tablet to match active comparator

drop_withdraw_reason.title: The subject was randomized, but did not take any investigational product
The subject was randomized, but did not take any investigational product

group.title: Bexagliflozin Tablets, 20 mg
group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study. Bexagliflozin: 20 mg, tablet

group.title: Placebo Tablets
group.description: Each subject will receive placebo (inactive tablet) once daily for the duration of the study. Placebo: 20 mg tablet to match active comparator

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Cardiovascular Risk Groups
measure.description: 1: History of atherosclerotic vascular disease with > 1 of the following: i) MI/ischemic stroke > 3 months but < 5 years prior to screening ii) Documented history of coronary, carotid or peripheral arterial revascularization (CABG must have occurred > 5 years prior to screening) 2: History of heart failure 3: Age >= 55 with > 2 of the following: i) Diabetes duration of > 10 years ii) Uncontrolled hypertension defined as SBP > 140 mmHg despite > 3 anti-hypertensive medications iii) current smoker iv) Urine albumin: creatinine ratio > 30 mg/g v) eGFR 45-60 mL/min/1.73 m2 vi) HDL < 1 mmol/L

category.title: Group 1: History of atherosclerotic vascular disease
Group 3: Age >= 55 years with > 2 risk factors

measure.title: Duration of Diabetes from Diagnosis to the date of informed consent
Use of Anti-Diabetic Treatment at Baseline

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 24
outcome.description: The primary efficacy objective of this trial is to evaluate the placebo-adjusted change in HbA1c from baseline after 24 weeks of treatment with 20 mg bexagliflozin tablets in type 2 diabetic subjects with increased risk of cardiovascular adverse events.
outcome.population: Number of subjects with a value at baseline and at Week 24.

group.title: Bexagliflozin Tablets, 20 mg
group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study. Bexagliflozin: 20 mg, tablet

group.title: Placebo Tablets
group.description: Each subject will receive placebo (inactive tablet) once daily for the duration of the study. Placebo: 20 mg tablet to match active comparator

measure.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 24
measure.description: The primary efficacy objective of this trial is to evaluate the placebo-adjusted change in HbA1c from baseline after 24 weeks of treatment with 20 mg bexagliflozin tablets in type 2 diabetic subjects with increased risk of cardiovascular adverse events.
measure.population: Number of subjects with a value at baseline and at Week 24.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis for the primary endpoint was that the mean change in HbA1c from baseline to Week 24 in the bexagliflozin arm would be equal to or greater than the mean change in the placebo arm.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Rejection of the null hypothesis would imply that the mean change in baseline HbA1c from baseline to Week 24 was less than the mean change in the placebo arm by a value that could not be attributed to chance alone.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is based on one sided statistical tests using a 0.025 level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Region, baseline eGFR categories and BMI, history of heart failure, insulin use (Y/N), treatment, visit and baseline HbA1c as fixed effect covariate.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 24 for Subjects Who Have Been Prescribed Insulin
outcome.description: To evaluate the effect of 20 mg bexagliflozin on the change in HbA1c from baseline to week 24 in randomized subjects who have been prescribed insulin to control their diabetes
outcome.population: Number of subjects with a value at baseline and at week 24.

analysis.method_desc: Region, baseline eGFR categories, history of heart failure, treatment, visit and baseline HbA1c as fixed effect covariate.

outcome.population: Number of subjects with a value at baseline and at Week 48 is included.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is based on one sided statistical tests using a 0.025 level of significance.

analysis.estimate_desc: Odds ratio is calculated as the odds ratio of bexagliflozin over placebo.

outcome.title: Proportion of Subjects Requiring an Intensification of Hypoglycemic Agent and Time to First Intensification
outcome.description: To measure the proportion of subjects requiring an intensification of hypoglycemic agent in the bexagliflozin arm versus placebo during the entire study period

group.title: Bexagliflozin Tablets, 20 mg
group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study. Bexagliflozin: 20 mg, tablet

group.title: Placebo Tablets
group.description: Each subject will receive placebo (inactive tablet) once daily for the duration of the study. Placebo: 20 mg tablet to match active comparator

measure.title: Proportion of Subjects Requiring an Intensification of Hypoglycemic Agent and Time to First Intensification
measure.description: To measure the proportion of subjects requiring an intensification of hypoglycemic agent in the bexagliflozin arm versus placebo during the entire study period

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is based on one sided statistical tests using a 0.025 level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Region, baseline eGFR categories & BMI, history of heart failure, insulin use (Y/N), treatment and baseline HbA1c as fixed effect covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio and p-value were estimated using Cox regression model for time to first event in the bexagliflozin arm vs. placebo arm during entire study.

outcome.title: Proportion of Subjects Requiring a Relaxation of Hypoglycemic Agent
outcome.description: To measure the proportion of subjects requiring a relaxation of hypoglycemic agent in the bexagliflozin arm versus placebo during 24 week period

group.title: Bexagliflozin Tablets, 20 mg
group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study. Bexagliflozin: 20 mg, tablet

group.title: Placebo Tablets

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value is based on one sided statistical tests using a 0.025 level of significance.
analysis.method_desc: Region, baseline eGFR categories & BMI, history of heart failure, insulin use (Y/N), treatment and baseline HbA1c as fixed effect covariate.

outcome.title: Proportion of Participants With Incidence of Hospitalization for Heart Failure
outcome.description: To measure the incidence of hospitalization for heart failure among all subjects and among subjects who have a history of heart failure at baseline

group.title: All Subjects: Bexagliflozin Tablets, 20 mg
group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study. Bexagliflozin: 20 mg, tablet This group includes all subjects who have received bexagliflozin in the study.

group.title: All Subjects: Placebo Tablets
group.description: Each subject will receive placebo (inactive tablet) once daily for the duration of the study. Placebo: 20 mg tablet to match active comparator This group includes all subjects who have received placebo in the study.

group.title: Subjects With HF History: Bexagliflozin Tablets, 20 mg
group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study. Bexagliflozin: 20 mg, tablet This group includes subjects who reported a history of heart failure and randomized to the bexagliflozin arm.

group.title: Subjects With HF History: Placebo
group.description: Each subject will receive placebo (inactive tablet) once daily for the duration of the study. Placebo: 20 mg tablet to match active comparator This group includes subjects who reported a history of heart failure and randomized to the placebo arm.

measure.title: Proportion of Participants With Incidence of Hospitalization for Heart Failure
measure.description: To measure the incidence of hospitalization for heart failure among all subjects and among subjects who have a history of heart failure at baseline

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected from the first dose to the last day of follow up (4 weeks after the End of Treatment visit, an average of 127 weeks)

group.title: Bexagliflozin Tablets, 20 mg
group.description: Each subject will receive bexagliflozin 20 mg once daily for the duration of the study. Bexagliflozin: 20 mg, tablet

group.title: Placebo Tablets
group.description: Each subject will receive placebo (inactive tablet) once daily for the duration of the study. Placebo: 20 mg tablet to match active comparator

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Malignant neoplasm of ampulla of Vater

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
